fields.name: configuration
fields.description: Retrieve the configuration record.

fields.name: datasets
fields.description: Find all dataset configurations.

fields.name: dataset
fields.description: Retrieve a specific dataset configuration.

fields.name: stores
fields.description: Find all named store configurations.

fields.name: store
fields.description: Retrieve the named store configuration.

fields.name: snapshot
fields.description: Retrieve a specific snapshot.

fields.name: tree
fields.description: Retrieve a specific tree.

types.name: Store
types.description: Local or remote store for pack files.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Opaque identifier of this store.

fields.name: label
fields.description: User-defined label for this store configuration.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The type, or kind, of the store (e.g. "local", "minio", "glacier").

fields.name: options
fields.description: Base64 encoded JSON of store options.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

fields.name: defineStore
fields.description: Define a new store with the given configuration.

fields.name: updateStore
fields.description: Update the saved store configuration.

fields.name: deleteStore
fields.description: Delete the named store, returning its current configuration.

fields.name: defineDataset
fields.description: Define a new dataset with the given configuration.

fields.name: updateDataset
fields.description: Update an existing dataset with the given configuration.

fields.name: deleteDataset
fields.description: Delete the named dataset, returning its current configuration.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: An integer type larger than the standard signed 32-bit.

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: Name of the computer on which this application is running.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Name of the user running this application.

fields.name: computerId
fields.description: Computer UUID for generating bucket names.

types.name: Dataset
types.description: The directory structure which will be saved.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Opaque identifier for this dataset (w/o db prefix).

fields.name: computerId
fields.description: Unique computer identifier.

fields.name: basepath
fields.description: Path that is being backed up.

fields.name: schedule
fields.description: Cron-like expression for the backup schedule.

fields.name: latestSnapshot
fields.description: Reference to most recent snapshot.

fields.name: packSize
fields.description:
Path to temporary workspace for backup process.
Specified byte length of pack files.

fields.name: stores
fields.description: Identifiers of stores used for saving packs.

types.name: TreeEntry
types.description: A file, directory, or link within a tree.

fields.name: name
fields.description: File system name of this entry.

fields.name: fstype
fields.description: File system type of this entry.

fields.name: reference
fields.description: Coordinates for this entry in the database.

fields.name: checksum
fields.description: Computed checksum of the snapshot.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The snapshot before this one, if any.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time when the snapshot was first created.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time when the snapshot completely finished.

fields.name: fileCount
fields.description: Total number of files contained in this snapshot.

fields.name: tree
fields.description: Reference to the tree containing all of the files.

types.name: Checksum
types.description: A SHA1 or SHA256 checksum, with algorithm prefix.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Identifier of dataset to update, None if creating.

inputFields.name: basepath
inputFields.description: Path that is being backed up.

inputFields.name: schedule
inputFields.description: Cron-like expression for the backup schedule.

inputFields.name: packSize
inputFields.description:
Path to temporary workspace for backup process.
Desired byte length of pack files.

inputFields.name: stores
inputFields.description: Identifiers of stores used for saving packs.

types.name: EntryType
types.description: Type of the entry in the tree.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred when processing this entry.

types.name: Tree
types.description: A collection of files, directories, and links.
